dataset.title: This file contains total numbers of the 22 different types of critters (depending on species, size, maturity, or all three) caught from the two drift distance experiments on the Kuparuk River in 1989, Arctic LTER 1989.

abstract.para: This file contains total numbers of the 22 different types of critters (depending on species, size, maturity, or all three) caught from the two drift distance experiments on the Kuparuk River in 1989. One experiment was on 7 July 1989 at the -500m station, the other was on 10 July 1989 at the 1.7km station.

intellectualRights.para: Acceptance and utilization of LTER data requires that:

listitem.para: The Principal Investigator be sent a notice stating reasons for acquiring any data and a description of the publication intentions.
The Principal Investigator of the data set be sent a copy of the report or manuscript prior to submission and be adequately cited in any resultant publications

A copy of any resultant publications should be sent to:
Principal Investigator Ecosystems Center Marine Biological Laboratory Woods Hole, MA 02543

geographicCoverage.geographicDescription: Kuparuk River, in Arctic Alaska, near where the river crosses the haul road.

description.para:
Log of changes:
3Oct91 question about the number of records in the data file (44 or 38).

For Archival Use:
DATE RECEIVED: JUl 91 DATA FILE ENTERED BY: Julie Pallant DATA FILE VALIDATION: NAME: Julie Pallant DATE: 3Oct91

para.literalLayout: Drift samples were taken at 2m, 4m, 8m, 16m, and 32m distances downstream from an arbitrary point in the river. After those samples were retrieved and prepared for storage, a very large Nitex net was positioned at the "arbitrary" point and all invertevrate drift flow was stopped. Now, a new set of 2m, 4m, 8m, 16m, and 32m drift distances were taken downstream from the net. The data file calls these samples "2m before, 2m after, ...".

Variable Variable descrip. Precis./Units Coded Missing (Y/N) Values SITE Site code y DATE Date of experiment n SPECIES Type of invertebrate n 2m before.. 32m after Distance downstream from the n net: (before = before the net was in place, after = after the net was in place.) number caught n COMMENTS Comments about the data n blank (12) CALCULATIONS Variable Formula
